quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Light and Color
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, method, solution. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In algebra, what is an Abelian group?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A group that is commutative

questions.question: When a wave of light with a wavelength of approximately 700 nm hits your eyes, it causes sensation of what color?
What is the science of colors called?
Who was the first mathematician to use the term group?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Evariste Galois

questions.question: Chemiluminescence is a phenomenon involving which of the following processes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Emitting light

questions.question: What objects do we call translucent?

options.text: Objects that transmit light and scatter it
Objects that reflect all light specularly (i.e. in the manner of a mirror)
Objects that transmit light but do not scatter it

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Objects that transmit light and scatter it

questions.question: The subject that studies the solution of a system of linear inequalities is called Linear Programming. Which of these men was most instrumental in its development?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George B. Dantzig

questions.question: Different colors derive form the different wavelengths of the spectrum of light. What part of it do we call visible light, i.e. we can perceive with our eyes?
In the set of real numbers under the operation of multiplication, every number has an inverse.
Which is the color from the visible spectrum produced by waves of the smallest wavelength?
In the group of whole numbers under addition, what is the additive identity of 7?
Which famous mathematician proved that there is no formula to find the roots of any equation of degree more than four?
What component of the human eye is responsible for the perception of light of different wavelengths, which results into color vision?
If an object scatters light in all wavelengths, what color does it appear to be?
This mathematician was the first to develop an algebraic method of solving any cubic equation.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nicolai Fontana Tartaglia

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Sun and Light
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, condition, radiation. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The mean distance between the Sun and the Earth is about 93 million miles, which is also called what by astronomers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Astronomical Unit (AU)

questions.question: It has been calculated that human beings can distinguish this many different colors.
How long does it take light to travel from the Sun to the Earth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: About 8 minutes

questions.question: For a few seconds after exposure to strong light we continue to see the shape of the light source even after we dont look at it any more. What are these fleeting images in our brain called?
Which of the following colors is an example of a Tyndall effect color?

options.text: The red of the red apple
The color of the human skin
The blue of the human iris

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The blue of the human iris

questions.question: According to the color theory what should red paint look viewed under blue light?
What two main characteristics measure the properties of light in the human visible range?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frequency and intensity

questions.question: Synesthesia is a special condition of the brain which is characterized by which of the following unusual events?

options.text: Seeing colors generated by the brain not based on reality
Seeing colors when listening to music or reading letters/numbers

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Seeing colors when listening to music or reading letters/numbers

questions.question: What important work connected to color theory did the international group of experts known as the Commission Internationale de leclairage (CIE) create in 1931?

options.text: Mapped the frequency of basic colors in the spectrum
Developed a mathematical model of color
Developed the color model of the universe
Defined the primary, secondary, and tertiary colors

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Developed a mathematical model of color

questions.question: Which of the statements about the spectral colors and light sensation in humans is true?

options.text: Spectral light causes equivalent color sensations in most mammal species.
In order to cause a sensation of a certain color the light should be emitted only in this color.
There are more possible spectral combinations than color sensations in the human brain.
There are more possible color sensations in the human brain than spectral combinations.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: There are more possible spectral combinations than color sensations in the human brain.

questions.question: Compared to men, women are much more likely to fall into this group in regards to their color vision.
Which of the following colors cannot be a pure spectral color?
The Sun creates its radiation (heat) by the nuclear fusion between which two elements?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hydrogen and Helium

questions.question: Which species has the most complex color vision system in the animal kingdom?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mantis shrimp

questions.question: In most computer monitors which of these colors is not accomplished by simply emitting in the respective wavelength?

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Muscles and Sun
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, field, push. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Suns magnetic field, driven by the Solar Wind, can reach distances how far out into space?

options.text: Just past the orbit of Mercury
Just inside the orbit of Jupiter
Between Pluto and the Oort Cloud

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Into Interstellar space

questions.question: How many muscles are in the human body?
The Suns surface temperature is roughly 10,000 degrees F. The temperature at the Suns core, however can be as high as what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2,000,000 degrees F.

questions.question: A Solar Eclipse occurs when the Earth is between the Sun and the Moon.
There are 3 types of muscle in the human body. What are they?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cardiac, Skeletal, Smooth

questions.question: On average, how much of a persons body weight is muscle?
Doctors dont believe that growing causes pain, so growing pains do not exist.
How many muscles are in your face?
While muscle stimulation occurs during weight lifting and resistance exercises, muscle growth occurs later when the muscles are at rest.
How long does it take the Sun to rotate once upon its axis?

options.text: The Sun does not rotate at all

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: About 24 to 28 days

questions.question: Which of these would not cause a muscle cramp?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: being overweight

questions.question: Muscles push and pull-- thats how you can wriggle your fingers back and forth.
The Sun contains about what percentage of the entire solar systems mass?
The period of time between maximum and minimum sunspot activity, known as the Solar Cycle is about how many years in length?
What Greek mythological figure flew too close to the sun with his wings made of wax?

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Taste and Substances
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, habit, muscles. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What connects muscles to bones?
Which is the most bitter substance known to taste researchers?
Which are the four tastes considered as basic in Western culture?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bitter, sweet, sour and salty

questions.question: Taste is related to what other basic sense?
You should always warm up your muscles before lifting weights.
The ability to perceive the unpleasant taste of bitter is assumed by researchers to have evolved with this function.

options.text: To help people choose tasty foods to bad tasting ones
To help people choose foods with more vitamins

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To protect people from poisoning

questions.question: In order to adapt to the dry environment, cacti completely lost their leaves in the process of evolution.
Which of these is NOT one of cactis mechanisms for preserving water?

options.text: A waxy coating on the surface of the plant

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Reduced stem volume

questions.question: Which of these continents represent the natural habit of the cactus?

options.text: North America, South America and Africa

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South and North America

questions.question: Each basic taste corresponds to a specific area of the tongue, which perceives it. This spacial division of taste receptors is called taste map.
Saltiness is a taste sensation produced most strongly by which of the following chemical compounds?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sodium chloride

questions.question: Sourness is a taste that is a proof of which of the following properties of substances?
The carbonyl chemical group in substances evokes the sensation of what taste?
The taste called umami, which is considered by the Japanese and Chinese taste researchers for one of the basic tastes, is mainly associated with which of the following groups of substances?
In taste science, what is the meaning of the term supertaster?

options.text: A food with sharper taste than average
A person with sharper sense of taste than average
A person who tastes foods and beverages professionally
A supercomputer with sensors able to detect extremely tastes accurately

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A person with sharper sense of taste than average

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Cactus and Medicine
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, beliefs, mood. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Cacti can only be pollinated by a certain type of tropical bees.
The coat of arms of which country includes a depiction of a cactus?
Tinctures in herbal medicine are made by mixing dried herbs with oils, such as sesame oil or almond oil.
Color therapy assumes that each color influences differently our moods, levels of energy and even mental state and abilities. What is the color red usually associated with?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Passion and strength

questions.question: This type of alternative medicine is based on the assumption that if large amounts of a certain substance cause symptoms of illness, then small amounts of this same substance can alleviate symptoms by activating the body’s self-healing abilities.
What is the origin of the word cactus?
Ayurveda, chiropractic, traditional Chinese medicine and homeopathy are all forms of alternative medicine that adopt which of the following principles?
This form of alternative medicine focuses on stimulating different areas of the feet.
Which of these processes does the cactus perform only at night?

One of the fundamental beliefs of ayurveda is that five elements form the Universe and everything in it including the human body. These elements are earth, fire, water, air and which of the following?
This health care discipline uses mostly the technique of spinal adjustment.
In aromatherapy, essential oils are often used to enhance the mood.
In which of the following areas are cacti used?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Because of the strict water preserving mechanisms, the cactus dies within hours after a part of it is broken or damaged.
Which part of the cactus performs the process of photosynthesis?

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Blood and Cells
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, condition, deity. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Acupressure uses which of the following techniques?

options.text: Inserting needles into certain points of the body
Finger or hand pressure on certain points of the body

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Finger or hand pressure on certain points of the body

questions.question: Saturns rings consist mostly of water ice.
Saturn is the Roman name of which Greek deity?
Which of these names refers to or is a synonym for red blood cells?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: For the removal of which of these waste products is blood responsible?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of these organs is responsible for the degradation of red blood cells?
Which of these organs is responsible for the production of blood proteins, including clotting proteins?
Which of the following is NOT a type of yoga?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Asana yoga

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about the human blood plasma?

options.text: It comprises 55% of the blood content.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It comprises 55% of the blood content.

questions.question: In astrology Saturn is believed to be the planetary ruler of which sign?
Which of these terms refers to the formation of blood cells?
What are the blood cells called thrombocytes responsible for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blood clotting

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about the white blood cells, also called leukocytes?

options.text: They are cells of the immune system.
There are five different types of white blood cells.
There are leukocytes in the lymph.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of these factors defines the medical condition known as anemia?

options.text: Decreased number of red blood cells
Decreased oxygen-binding ability of the hemoglobin molecules in the blood
Decreased quantity of hemoglobin in the blood

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What does the term blood serum refer to?

options.text: Blood plasma without the clotting proteins
It is a synonym for blood plasma.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blood plasma without the clotting proteins
